intro: Linociera obscurinervis, commonly known as the dark-veined liana, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominently visible dark veins. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, spherical berries. Linociera obscurinervis is often found in moist, shaded forest understories where it thrives in humid, warm climates.
